page.title: 02SOUTH CENTRAL GATESHEAD 2
page.content: Several of the settlements are very old. They formed individual villages. During the 19th century areas of industrial housing were built and in the 20th century much of the remaining land was built on to form estates - housing areas with some amenities.In many cases these new housing areas were built to replace houses in the town centre which were too old,the old houses have been knocked down. All of these areas were given names which appear on the O.S. Map. Examples of the old villages are Eighton Banks and Lamesley. An example of a 19th Century industrial settlement is Wrekenton. Examples of 20th Century Council and Private estates (some estates have both council and private houses) are Blackhill,White Hills and Chowdene.
